verb.description: Leave bare of accessories or fittings.
examples: thieves stripped the room of luggage

verb.description: Deprive someone of (rank, power, or property)
examples: the lieutenant was stripped of his rank

verb.description: Sell off (the assets of a company) for profit.
Tear the thread or teeth from (a screw, gearwheel, etc.).
(of a bullet) be fired from a rifled gun without spin owing to a loss of surface.

noun.description: An act of undressing, especially in a striptease.
examples: she got drunk and did a strip on top of the piano

origin: Late Middle English: from or related to Middle Low German strippe strap, thong, probably also to stripe.
